00102 //   Data Storage Options

00105 /* MPFS Configuration
00106  *   MPFS is automatically included when required for other 
00107  *   applications.  If your custom application requires it 
00108  *   otherwise, uncomment the appropriate selection.
00109  */
00110 //#define STACK_USE_MPFS
00111 #define STACK_USE_MPFS2
00112 
00113 /* MPFS Storage Location
00114  *   If html pages are stored in internal program memory,
00115  *   comment both MPFS_USE_EEPROM and MPFS_USE_SPI_FLASH, then
00116  *   include an MPFS image (.c or .s file) in the project.  
00117  *   If html pages are stored in external memory, uncomment the 
00118  *   appropriate definition.
00119  *
00120  *   Supported serial flash parts include the SST25VFxxxB series.
00121  */
00122 #define MPFS_USE_EEPROM
00123 //#define MPFS_USE_SPI_FLASH
00124 
00125 /* EEPROM Addressing Selection
00126  *   If using the 1Mbit EEPROM, uncomment this line
00127  */
00128 //#define USE_EEPROM_25LC1024
00129 
00130 /* EEPROM Reserved Area
00131  *   Number of EEPROM bytes to be reserved before MPFS storage starts.
00132  *   These bytes host application configurations such as IP Address,
00133  *   MAC Address, and any other required variables.
00134  *
00135  *   For MPFS Classic, this setting must match the Reserved setting
00136  *       on the Advanced Settings page of the MPFS2 Utility.
00137  */
00138 #define MPFS_RESERVE_BLOCK              (980ul)
00139 
00140 /* MPFS File Handles
00141  *   Maximum number of simultaneously open MPFS2 files.
00142  *   For MPFS Classic, this has no effect.
00143  */
00144 #define MAX_MPFS_HANDLES                                (5ul)
00145

00151 /* Default Network Configuration
00152  *   These settings are only used if data is not found in EEPROM.
00153  *   To clear EEPROM, hold BUTTON0, reset the board, and continue
00154  *   holding until the LEDs flash.  Release, and reset again.
00155  */
00156 #define MY_DEFAULT_HOST_NAME                    "MCHPBOARD2"
00157 
00158 #define MY_DEFAULT_MAC_BYTE1            (0x00)
00159 #define MY_DEFAULT_MAC_BYTE2            (0x04)
00160 #define MY_DEFAULT_MAC_BYTE3            (0xA3)
00161 #define MY_DEFAULT_MAC_BYTE4            (0x00)
00162 #define MY_DEFAULT_MAC_BYTE5            (0x00)
00163 #define MY_DEFAULT_MAC_BYTE6            (0x00)
00164 
00165 #define MY_DEFAULT_IP_ADDR_BYTE1        (192ul)
00166 #define MY_DEFAULT_IP_ADDR_BYTE2        (168ul)
00167 #define MY_DEFAULT_IP_ADDR_BYTE3        (1ul)
00168 #define MY_DEFAULT_IP_ADDR_BYTE4        (99ul)
00169 
00170 #define MY_DEFAULT_MASK_BYTE1           (255ul)
00171 #define MY_DEFAULT_MASK_BYTE2           (255ul)
00172 #define MY_DEFAULT_MASK_BYTE3           (255ul)
00173 #define MY_DEFAULT_MASK_BYTE4           (0ul)
00174 
00175 #define MY_DEFAULT_GATE_BYTE1           (192ul)
00176 #define MY_DEFAULT_GATE_BYTE2           (168ul)
00177 #define MY_DEFAULT_GATE_BYTE3           (1ul)
00178 #define MY_DEFAULT_GATE_BYTE4           (1ul)
00179 
00180 #define MY_DEFAULT_PRIMARY_DNS_BYTE1    (192ul)
00181 #define MY_DEFAULT_PRIMARY_DNS_BYTE2    (168ul)
00182 #define MY_DEFAULT_PRIMARY_DNS_BYTE3    (1ul)
00183 #define MY_DEFAULT_PRIMARY_DNS_BYTE4    (1ul)
00184 
00185 #define MY_DEFAULT_SECONDARY_DNS_BYTE1  (192ul)
00186 #define MY_DEFAULT_SECONDARY_DNS_BYTE2  (168ul)
00187 #define MY_DEFAULT_SECONDARY_DNS_BYTE3  (1ul)
00188 #define MY_DEFAULT_SECONDARY_DNS_BYTE4  (2ul)

00191 // =======================================================================
00192 //   Transport Layer Options
00193 // =======================================================================
00194 
00195 /* Transport Layer Configuration
00196  *   The following low level modules are automatically enabled
00197  *   based on module selections above.  If your custom module
00198  *   requires them otherwise, enable them here.
00199  */
00200 #define STACK_USE_TCP
00201 #define STACK_USE_UDP
00202 
00203 /* Client Mode Configuration
00204  *   Uncomment following line if this stack will be used in CLIENT
00205  *   mode.  In CLIENT mode, some functions specific to client operation
00206  *   are enabled.
00207  */
00208 #define STACK_CLIENT_MODE
00209 
00210 /* TCP Socket Memory Allocation
00211  *   TCP needs memory to buffer incoming and outgoing data.  The 
00212  *   amount and medium of storage can be allocated on a per-socket
00213  *   basis using the example below as a guide.
00214  */
00215         // Allocate how much total RAM (in bytes) you want to allocate 
00216         // for use by your TCP TCBs, RX FIFOs, and TX FIFOs.  
00217         #define TCP_ETH_RAM_SIZE                                        (1538ul)
00218         #define TCP_PIC_RAM_SIZE                                        (0ul)
00219         #define TCP_SPI_RAM_SIZE                                        (0ul)
00220         #define TCP_SPI_RAM_BASE_ADDRESS                        (0x00)
00221         
00222         // Define names of socket types
00223         #define TCP_SOCKET_TYPES
00224                 #define TCP_PURPOSE_GENERIC_TCP_CLIENT 0
00225                 #define TCP_PURPOSE_GENERIC_TCP_SERVER 1
00226                 #define TCP_PURPOSE_TELNET 2
00227                 #define TCP_PURPOSE_FTP_COMMAND 3
00228                 #define TCP_PURPOSE_FTP_DATA 4
00229                 #define TCP_PURPOSE_TCP_PERFORMANCE_TX 5
00230                 #define TCP_PURPOSE_TCP_PERFORMANCE_RX 6
00231                 #define TCP_PURPOSE_UART_2_TCP_BRIDGE 7
00232                 #define TCP_PURPOSE_HTTP_SERVER 8
00233                 #define TCP_PURPOSE_DEFAULT 9
00234                 #define TCP_PURPOSE_BERKELEY_SERVER 10
00235                 #define TCP_PURPOSE_BERKELEY_CLIENT 11
00236         #define END_OF_TCP_SOCKET_TYPES
00237         
00238         #if defined(__TCP_C)
00239                 // Define what types of sockets are needed, how many of 
00240                 // each to include, where their TCB, TX FIFO, and RX FIFO
00241                 // should be stored, and how big the RX and TX FIFOs should 
00242                 // be.  Making this initializer bigger or smaller defines 
00243                 // how many total TCP sockets are available.
00244                 //
00245                 // Each socket requires up to 48 bytes of PIC RAM and 
00246                 // 40+(TX FIFO size)+(RX FIFO size) bytes bytes of 
00247                 // TCP_*_RAM each.
00248                 // Note: The RX FIFO must be at least 1 byte in order to 
00249                 // receive SYN and FIN messages required by TCP.  The TX 
00250                 // FIFO can be zero if desired.
00251                 #define TCP_CONFIGURATION
00252                 ROM struct
00253                 {
00254                         BYTE vSocketPurpose;
00255                         BYTE vMemoryMedium;
00256                         WORD wTXBufferSize;
00257                         WORD wRXBufferSize;
00258                 } TCPSocketInitializer[] = 
00259                 {
00260                         //{TCP_PURPOSE_GENERIC_TCP_CLIENT, TCP_ETH_RAM, 125, 100},
00261                         //{TCP_PURPOSE_GENERIC_TCP_SERVER, TCP_ETH_RAM, 20, 20},
00262                         //{TCP_PURPOSE_TELNET, TCP_ETH_RAM, 150, 20},
00263                         //{TCP_PURPOSE_FTP_COMMAND, TCP_ETH_RAM, 100, 40},
00264                         //{TCP_PURPOSE_FTP_DATA, TCP_ETH_RAM, 0, 128},
00265                         //{TCP_PURPOSE_TCP_PERFORMANCE_TX, TCP_ETH_RAM, 256, 1},
00266                         //{TCP_PURPOSE_TCP_PERFORMANCE_RX, TCP_ETH_RAM, 40, 360},
00267                         //{TCP_PURPOSE_UART_2_TCP_BRIDGE, TCP_ETH_RAM, 256, 256},
00268                         {TCP_PURPOSE_HTTP_SERVER, TCP_ETH_RAM, 200, 200},
00269                         {TCP_PURPOSE_HTTP_SERVER, TCP_ETH_RAM, 200, 200},
00270                         {TCP_PURPOSE_DEFAULT, TCP_ETH_RAM, 200, 200},
00271                         //{TCP_PURPOSE_BERKELEY_SERVER, TCP_ETH_RAM, 25, 20},
00272                         //{TCP_PURPOSE_BERKELEY_SERVER, TCP_ETH_RAM, 25, 20},
00273                         //{TCP_PURPOSE_BERKELEY_SERVER, TCP_ETH_RAM, 25, 20},
00274                         //{TCP_PURPOSE_BERKELEY_CLIENT, TCP_ETH_RAM, 125, 100},
00275                 };
00276                 #define END_OF_TCP_CONFIGURATION
00277         #endif
00278 
00279 /* UDP Socket Configuration
00280  *   Define the maximum number of available UDP Sockets, and whether
00281  *   or not to include a checksum on packets being transmitted.
00282  */
00283 #define MAX_UDP_SOCKETS     (5u)
00284 //#define UDP_USE_TX_CHECKSUM           // This slows UDP TX performance by nearly 50%
00285 
00286 
00287 /* Berkeley API Sockets Configuration
00288  *   Note that each Berkeley socket internally uses one TCP or UDP socket 
00289  *   defined by MAX_UDP_SOCKETS and the TCPSocketInitializer[] array.  
00290  *   Therefore, this number MUST be less than or equal to MAX_UDP_SOCKETS + the 
00291  *   number of TCP sockets defined by the TCPSocketInitializer[] array 
00292  *   (i.e. sizeof(TCPSocketInitializer)/sizeof(TCPSocketInitializer[0])).
00293  *   This define has no effect if STACK_USE_BERKELEY_API is not defined and 
00294  *   Berkeley Sockets are disabled.  Set this value as low as your application 
00295  *   requires to avoid waisting RAM.
00296  */
00297 #define BSD_SOCKET_COUNT (5u)
00298 
00299 
00300 // =======================================================================
00301 //   Application-Specific Options
00302 // =======================================================================
00303 
00304 // -- HTTP2 Server options -----------------------------------------------
00305 
00306         // Maximum numbers of simultaneous HTTP connections allowed.
00307         // Each connection consumes 2 bytes of RAM and a TCP socket
00308         #define MAX_HTTP_CONNECTIONS    (2u)
00309         
00310         // Indicate what file to serve when no specific one is requested
00311         #define HTTP_DEFAULT_FILE               "index.htm"
00312         #define HTTPS_DEFAULT_FILE              "index.htm"
00313         #define HTTP_DEFAULT_LEN                (10u)                   // For buffer overrun protection.
00314                                                                                                 // Set to longest length of above two strings.
00315         
00316         // Configure MPFS over HTTP updating
00317         // Comment this line to disable updating via HTTP
00318         #define HTTP_MPFS_UPLOAD                "mpfsupload"
00319         //#define HTTP_MPFS_UPLOAD_REQUIRES_AUTH        // Require password for MPFS uploads
00320                 // Certain firewall and router combinations cause the MPFS2 Utility to fail 
00321                 // when uploading.  If this happens, comment out this definition.
00322         
00323         // Define which HTTP modules to use
00324         // If not using a specific module, comment it to save resources
00325         #define HTTP_USE_POST                                   // Enable POST support
00326 //      #define HTTP_USE_COOKIES                                // Enable cookie support
00327         #define HTTP_USE_AUTHENTICATION                 // Enable basic authentication support
00328         
00329 //      #define HTTP_NO_AUTH_WITHOUT_SSL                // Uncomment to require SSL before requesting a password
00330         #define HTTP_SSL_ONLY_CHAR              (0xff)  // Files beginning with this character will only be served over HTTPS
00331                                                                                         // Set to 0x00 to require for all files
00332                                                                                         // Set to 0xff to require for no files
00333 
00334 //      #define STACK_USE_HTTP_APP_RECONFIG             // Use the AppConfig web page in the Demo App (~2.5kb ROM, ~0b RAM)
00335 //      #define STACK_USE_HTTP_MD5_DEMO                 // Use the MD5 Demo web page (~5kb ROM, ~160b RAM)
00336 //      #define STACK_USE_HTTP_EMAIL_DEMO               // Use the e-mail demo web page
00337 
00338 // -- SSL Options --------------------------------------------------------
00339 
00340         #define MAX_SSL_CONNECTIONS             (2ul)   // Maximum connections via SSL
00341         #define MAX_SSL_SESSIONS                (2ul)   // Max # of cached SSL sessions
00342         #define MAX_SSL_BUFFERS                 (4ul)   // Max # of SSL buffers (2 per socket)
00343         #define MAX_SSL_HASHES                  (5ul)   // Max # of SSL hashes  (2 per, plus 1 to avoid deadlock)
00344         
00345         #define SSL_RSA_KEY_SIZE                (512ul) // bits in SSL RSA key
00346 
00347 
00348 // -- SNMP Options -------------------------------------------------------
00349 
00350         // Comment following line if SNMP TRAP support is needed
00351         //#define SNMP_TRAP_DISABLED
00352 
00353 #endif
